alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Macon; McLean; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 4:12AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN PIATT...DE WITT... SOUTHERN MCLEAN AND NORTHEASTERN MACON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 AM CDT... At 412 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cooksville to near Argenta. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Bloomington, Clinton, Monticello, Le Roy, Heyworth, Farmer City, Maroa, Bement, Downs, Argenta, Wapella, De Land, Weldon, Kenney, Arrowsmith, Cisco, Ellsworth, De Witt, Weldon Springs State Park, and Clinton Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 between mile markers 149 and 158. Interstate 72 between mile markers 150 and 165. Interstate 74 between mile markers 133 and 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
